title: Taiga's Carry Chains
statementHtml:
After classes at Ohashi High School, Ryuuji hands Taiga a positive integer nn and sets a simple challenge.

They will play for exactly kk moves. In a single move, Taiga chooses a non-negative integer ℓℓ and sets n←n+2ℓn←n+2ℓ.

Ryuuji defines the score of one move as the number of binary carries that occur when adding 2ℓ2ℓ to the current number in base 22. The total score is the sum of score over all kk moves.

Taiga wants the total score to be as large as possible after kk moves. What is the maximum total score she can achieve?
inputSpecHtml:
Each test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases tt (1≤t≤10001≤t≤1000). The description of the test cases follows.

The only line of each test case contains two integers nn and kk (1≤n<2301≤n<230, 0≤k≤1090≤k≤109) — the initial integer and the number of moves.
outputSpecHtml: For each test case, output a single integer — the maximum total score that Taiga can achieve.
noteHtml:
In the first test case, (n,k)=(7,1)(n,k)=(7,1) and 7=11127=1112. Adding 2020 gives 111+1=1000111+1=1000, which produces carries at bits 0,1,20,1,2. So the total score is 33.

In the second test case, (n,k)=(13,2)(n,k)=(13,2) with 13=1101213=11012. First we add 2020: 1101+0001=11101101+0001=1110, which creates one carry. Then we add 2121: 1110+0010=100001110+0010=10000, with carries propagating through bits 1,2,31,2,3. In total there are 1+3=41+3=4 carries, so the score is 44.

In the third test case, (n,k)=(42,2)(n,k)=(42,2) and 42=101010242=1010102. First we add 2121: 101010+000010=101100101010+000010=101100, giving one carry. Next we add 2222: 101100+000100=110000101100+000100=110000, which generates carries at bits 22 and 33. Thus the total number of carries is 1+2=31+2=3.

In the fifth test case, (n,k)=(23,2)(n,k)=(23,2) and 23=10111223=101112. First we add 2020: 10111+00001=1100010111+00001=11000, which produces carries at bits 0,1,20,1,2. Then we add 2323: 11000+01000=10000011000+01000=100000, producing carries at bits 33 and 44. Altogether there are 3+2=53+2=5 carries, so the total score is 55.
